title: Wirecard lower as UBS downgrades stock on growth fears
text: Wirecard WDI, -1.35% shares slipped over 2% as UBS downgraded the stock to neutral from buy. UBS flagged concerns over slowing organic growth and the risk it may use proceeds from bonds -- including a 900 million euro convertible to SoftBank 9984, -2.29% -- for M&A. "While we still have a high regard for Wirecard's structural growth opportunity from a shift from cash-to-card and the convergence of eCommerce with brick-and-mortar activity, we think it will be difficult to sustain the current 30%+ organic growth rate seen recently over the medium-term. At the same time, we see limited downside risk given Wirecard's shares are trading at a discount to its payments peers, albeit some of this may still be explained given the uncertainty around internal risk governance and the ongoing investigation by the Singaporean authorities."
